items.title: PM, Jewish leaders condemn apparent firebombing of Hanukkah car
items.description: Authorities were called to a St Kilda East residence about 3am, where a car with a sign celebrating the Jewish holiday had been set alight.

items.title: Public assemblies banned for 14 days across Sydney as police enact new laws
items.description: The NSW Police Commissioner, Mal Lanyon, has activated new powers prescribed under changes to NSW protest laws sparked by the terrorist attack at Bondi Beach on December 14.

items.title: Charity, church services and cheer as Australians give back on Christmas Day
items.description: Australians have marked another Christmas Day with solemnity and celebration, with churches full and beaches packed.

items.title: White Christmas in Tasmania as heat climbs in other states
items.description: Snow has arrived in Tasmania on Christmas morning, but hotter conditions are expected around the country, including a scorcher in the west.

items.title: Australia opts for all-pace bowling attack for Boxing Day Test
items.description: With up to 10mm of grass on the MCG pitch, Australia has opted for a bold and historic option and left out offspinner Todd Murphy.

items.title: Boddington bushfire escalates amid 40C heat and gusty winds
items.description: A bushfire threatening the town of Boddington, south-east of Perth, has intensified as firefighters battle to contain the blaze on a hot and gusty 40-degree Celsius Christmas Day.

items.title: A million more Epstein files found, US government says
items.description: The Department of Justice says the release of the Epstein files will take "a few more weeks" after a million additional documents were uncovered.

items.title: Christmas Day cyclone greets remote Australian islands
items.description: Tropical Cyclone Grant is expected to remain a category one system as it passes just to the north of the Cocos (Keeling) Islands off the West Australian coast.

items.title: Fashion helps to heal community years after floods
items.description: Almost three years ago, a region in Western Australia's far north was devastated by once-in-a-century floods. Now fashion is stepping in, to heal scars and promote confidence.

items.title: US and Ukraine reach consensus on key issues to end war with Russia
items.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Ukraine has reached consensus with the US on key issues to end the war with Russia but sensitive issues around territorial control, along with the management of a nuclear power plant, still remain unresolved.

items.title: White House official says US forces to focus on 'quarantine' of Venezuela
items.description: The White House has ordered US military forces to focus almost exclusively on enforcing the "quarantine" of Venezuelan oil, a US official says.

items.title: As old-school camera repairers retire, what's the future of film?
items.description: As film photography surges in popularity among younger generations, technicians who repair analogue cameras are retiring, raising concerns it will become a dying art.

items.title: Pope Leo criticises 'distorted economy' in first Christmas mass
items.description: Pope Leo XIV holds the first Christmas mass of his pontificate, greeting thousands of faithful in St Peter's Square before the Christmas Eve service.

items.title: The last 600 Christians in Gaza mark Christmas with heavy hearts
items.description: The small number of Christians remaining in Gaza have marked Christmas early with subdued celebrations in the shadow of ongoing conflict and occupation.

items.title: 'Aussie' poster in Adelaide vandalised with 'white power' graffiti
items.description: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

items.title: Man dies after Christmas Eve stabbing near Perth shopping complex
items.description: Homicide squad detectives are investigating the fatal stabbing of a man near a shopping complex in Perth's southern suburbs late on Christmas Eve.

items.title: Will the ‘Scandinavian sleep method’ really help me sleep?
items.description: This arrangement allows couples to continue sleeping together while meeting each person's individual needs.

items.title: How Mackay's Filipino community maintains connection
items.description: Music, food and a festive mood are what make a Filipino Christmas Mass unique, according to organisers of a north Queensland Simbang Gabi celebration.

items.title: SA Labor stalwart and former federal minister Nick Bolkus dies
items.description: Nick Bolkus, the long-time Labor senator who played an influential role in shaping Australia's migration policy under prime minister Paul Keating, has died aged 75.

items.title: This couple is on opposite sides of the political divide. Here's how they make it work
items.description: More Australian relationships are struggling because of political divides. But experts say this does not have to be the end.

items.title: 'We push it to the max': She ready to add to Sydney to Hobart history
items.description: A fellowship of sailors will embark on She's 23rd Sydney to Hobart campaign. As they do they will honour one of the most resilient boats in the race's history and remember late owner Peter Rodgers.

items.title: How voice memos helped bring an 1,800-year-old first hymn back to life
items.description: Songwriters living in ancient Egypt would never have expected the words and melodies they sung would feature on Australian music charts 1,800 years later.

items.title: In sport, music and even maths, finding 'the zone' is a beautiful thing
items.description: There is a state of mind athletes talk about when they are totally absorbed in the moment and the actions of their sport.

items.title: What you need to know before you buy lab-grown versus natural diamonds
items.description: Diamonds are generally considered a luxury asset that holds its value, but the emergence of laboratory-grown diamonds in the jewellery industry over recent years could challenge that belief.

items.title: Long public transport trips are now a go-to for holiday homecomings
items.description: Budget-conscious travellers are turning to long-haul trips on public transport to get home for Christmas, but overcrowding and delays in the regions can cause headaches.
